meanings.definition: Producing more than one embryo from a single fertilized egg.
meanings.sent1: The polyembryonic mango tree bore many fruits.
meanings.sent2: The polyembryonic nature of the plant amazed the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The polyembryonic seeds seemed to be having a party inside the fruit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a polyembryonic garden, teeming with diverse thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The polyembryonic process in the animal kingdom is truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the development of multiple embryos from a single fertilized egg.
meanings.sent1: The polyembryonic lizard surprised the researchers with its unique development.
meanings.sent2: The polyembryonic trait in the species was a subject of great interest.
meanings.sent3: The polyembryonic eggs in the nest were like a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were polyembryonic, branching out in various directions.
meanings.sent5: The polyembryonic growth of the plant was a marvel of nature.
